name: saskatoon
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
a plant with small fruit you can eat, that grows mainly in northwestern parts of North America: Saskatoons grow in most soil types. Young saskatoon plants in pots will be available in mid summer.
imageBROKER/Helmut Meyer zur Capellen/GettyImages
(also saskatoon berry) the small fruit of this plant: Handfuls of dried saskatoons or other berries were added. Saskatoon berries are similar to blueberries.
ppl58/iStock/Getty Images Plus/GettyImages
More examplesFewer examplesThe bird landed in a swaying saskatoon shrub about 12 feet away.It can be cooked with berries like saskatoons to add sweetness and flavour.The saskatoon is to berries as the Cohiba is to cigars.
